title: About Me
text:
My Interests
I am a HUGE Potterhead (as evidenced by the picture below), and I love to read. More importantly, I love to tell stories, which is why NM2207 as a course stood out to me so much! :)

title: data story.qmd
text: Climate change poses a significant threat to ecosystems, economies, and human societies, making it one of the most urgent issues of our day. Land temperature is a key metric that stands out among the many indicators of climate change. It is crucial to comprehend how land temperature and climate change are related in order to fully appreciate the magnitude of this worldwide phenomenon.

title: data story.qmd
text: Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see https://quarto.org.

title: data story.qmd
text:
Running Code
When you click the Render button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

1 + 1

[1] 2


You can add options to executable code like this


[1] 4


The echo: false option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

title: data story.qmd
text: Climate change poses a significant threat to ecosystems, economies, and human societies, making it one of the most urgent issues of our day. Land temperature is a key metric that stands out among the many indicators of climate change. It is crucial to comprehend how land temperature and climate change are related in order to fully appreciate the magnitude of this worldwide phenomenon.

title: data story.qmd
text:
Land Temperature and Climate Change
Over the past century, the land surface temperature of Earth has been gradually rising. The rate at which land temperatures have been rising is concerning, ranging from the Arctic‚Äôs frozen tundra to Africa‚Äôs sun-drenched deserts. Human activity is the main cause of this temperature rise, especially the burning of fossil fuels and deforestation, which release greenhouse gases into the atmosphere that trap heat and cause global warming. The identified dataset on land temperatures is from an online source, Kaggle, which has repackaged the data from a newer compilation put together by the [Berkeley Earth](http://berkeleyearth.org/about/), which is affiliated with Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory. The Berkeley Earth Surface Temperature Study combines 1.6 billion temperature reports from 16 pre-existing archives.

title: Analysis of Data
text:
The below graph shows the global land temperature trend from 2000 to 2015, in the month of July.





Here we can see that, apart from the one anomaly in 2004, the land temperature was the lowest in 2000. Every subsequent year has been higher than 2000, with 2011 having the highest land temperature.

title: Analysis of Data
section: Land Temperature Trends- United States of America
text:
Land Temperature Trends- United States of America
The United States is one of the largest contributers to climate change, due to its high reliance on fossil fuels, . Lets analyse its land temperature from 2000 to 2013.
